title: Requires commissioners of health and general services to promulgate standards for the procurement and use of non-toxic commodities and services for hospitals
summary: Requires the commissioners of health and general services to promulgate standards for the procurement and use of environmentally sensitive commodities and services for hospitals; provides that these provisions shall be applicable to all hospitals.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law and  the  state  finance  law,  in
         relation  to  the  procurement  and  use  of environmentally sensitive
         commodities and services by hospitals

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  public health law is amended by adding a new section
    2  2805-u to read as follows:
    3    S 2805-U.  PROCUREMENT AND USE OF  ENVIRONMENTALLY  SENSITIVE  COMMOD-
    4  ITIES  AND  SERVICES.  1. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION THE FOLLOWING
    5  TERMS SHALL MEAN:
    6    (A) "ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE COMMODITIES AND SERVICES"  MEANS  THOSE
    7  COMMODITIES  AND  SERVICES  THAT  MINIMIZE ADVERSE IMPACTS ON THE PUBLIC
    8  HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AS DETERMINED BY THE COMMISSIONER OF  GENERAL
    9  SERVICES.
   10    (B)  "COMMODITY"  OR  "COMMODITIES"  MEANS  MATERIAL, GOODS, SUPPLIES,
   11  PRODUCTS, CONSTRUCTION ITEMS AND OTHER  STANDARD  ARTICLES  OF  COMMERCE
   12  OTHER THAN TECHNOLOGY.
   13    (C)   "CONSTRUCTION   ITEM"   MEANS  ANY  ITEM  OR  MATERIAL  USED  IN
   14  CONSTRUCTION AND WHICH IS PROCURED DIRECTLY BY A HOSPITAL OR BY A PERSON
   15  UNDER CONTRACT BY A HOSPITAL.
   16    (D) "SERVICE" OR "SERVICES" MEANS THE PERFORMANCE OF A TASK  OR  TASKS
   17  AND  MAY  INCLUDE  A  MATERIAL GOOD OR A QUANTITY OF MATERIAL GOODS, AND
   18  WHICH IS SUBJECT OF ANY PURCHASE OR OTHER EXCHANGE. FOR THE PURPOSES  OF
   19  THIS SECTION, TECHNOLOGY SHALL BE DEEMED A SERVICE.
   20    2.  THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  GENERAL  SERVICES, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE
   21  COMMISSIONER, SHALL ESTABLISH AND FROM TIME TO TIME AMEND GUIDELINES AND
   22  SPECIFICATIONS FOR ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE  COMMODITIES  AND  SERVICES
   23  FOR  USE  IN  HOSPITALS;  AND FOR USE IN THE CONSTRUCTION, RENOVATION OR
   24  REPAIR OF HOSPITAL BUILDINGS AND  RELATED  FACILITIES.  SUCH  GUIDELINES

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00178-01-1

       A. 3945                             2

    1  SHALL  BE  USED  TO  IDENTIFY  ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE COMMODITIES AND
    2  SERVICES WHICH ARE AVAILABLE IN THE FORM, FUNCTION AND UTILITY GENERALLY
    3  USED BY SUCH FACILITIES.  SUCH COMMISSIONERS SHALL REVIEW  AND  EVALUATE
    4  EXISTING  RESEARCH  REGARDING  ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE COMMODITIES AND
    5  SERVICES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE UNITED STATES  ENVIRONMENTAL
    6  PROTECTION AGENCY'S GUIDELINES FOR ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE COMMODITIES
    7  AND  SERVICES,  FOR  THE  PURPOSE OF DEVELOPING APPROPRIATE CRITERIA FOR
    8  SUCH GUIDELINES AND SPECIFICATIONS.
    9    3. THE COMMISSIONER OF  GENERAL  SERVICES  SHALL  DISSEMINATE  TO  ALL
   10  HOSPITALS GUIDELINES AND SPECIFICATIONS FOR THE PURCHASE OR USE OF ENVI-
   11  RONMENTALLY SENSITIVE COMMODITIES AND SERVICES IN HOSPITALS; AND FOR USE
   12  IN  THE  CONSTRUCTION,  RENOVATION  OR  REPAIR OF HOSPITAL BUILDINGS AND
   13  RELATED FACILITIES. THE COMMISSIONER  OF  GENERAL  SERVICES  SHALL  ALSO
   14  PREPARE  AND DISSEMINATE TO ALL HOSPITALS A SAMPLE LIST OF SUCH ENVIRON-
   15  MENTALLY SENSITIVE COMMODITIES AND SERVICES THAT MEET  THESE  GUIDELINES
   16  OR  SPECIFICATIONS  AND  THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH BENEFITS.  EVERY
   17  HOSPITAL SHALL CONSIDER SUCH GUIDELINES, SPECIFICATIONS AND SAMPLE  LIST
   18  WHEN   MAKING   DETERMINATIONS   AS  TO  THE  PURCHASE  OF  COMMODITIES,
   19  CONSTRUCTION ITEMS OR SERVICES FOR USE IN THE HOSPITAL, OR  FOR  USE  IN
   20  THE CONSTRUCTION, RENOVATION, OR REPAIR OF HOSPITAL BUILDINGS.
   21    4.  ON  OR  BEFORE  JUNE  FIRST,  TWO THOUSAND THIRTEEN, THE OFFICE OF
   22  GENERAL SERVICES AND THE DEPARTMENT SHALL JOINTLY ISSUE A REPORT PROVID-
   23  ING AN ANALYSIS OF THE IMPACT OF SUCH GUIDELINES AND  SPECIFICATIONS  ON
   24  THE PURCHASING AND PROCUREMENT PRACTICES OF HOSPITALS.
   25    S  2. Paragraph b of subdivision 3 of section 163 of the state finance
   26  law is amended by adding a new subparagraph (xii) to read as follows:
   27    (XII) MAINTAIN A LIST OF FIRMS WHICH PRODUCE OR MANUFACTURE  OR  OFFER
   28  FOR SALE ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE COMMODITIES AND SERVICES IN THE FORM,
   29  FUNCTION,  AND  UTILITY  GENERALLY  USED BY HOSPITALS IN ACCORDANCE WITH
   30  SPECIFICATIONS   OR   GUIDELINES   PROMULGATED   PURSUANT   TO   SECTION
   31  TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED FIVE-U OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW.
   32    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   33  it  shall  have  become a law; provided that the commissioners of health
   34  and general services are authorized to promulgate any and all rules  and
   35  regulations  and  take  any  other  measures  necessary to implement the
   36  provisions of this act on its effective date on or before such date; and
   37  provided, further, that the amendment to paragraph b of subdivision 3 of
   38  section 163 of the state finance law, made by section two of  this  act,
   39  shall not affect the repeal of such section and shall be deemed repealed
   40  therewith.
